class WidgetControllerStub

Detailed Description

Define the default widget layout to put sets of layout in it. 

  class MyController : public gaia::core::WidgetController {
    public:
      MyController(gaia::core::Page* page);
      virtual ~MyController();
  };

  //In your Page, customized WidgetController used to layout and control the widget.
  void MyPage::init() {
      mpController = new MyController(this);
      mpBtn1 = new gaia::core::Button(this);
      mpText1 = new gaia::core::TextWidget(this);
      if (mpController != NULL) {
          //Add Button the controller
          mpController->addWidget(mpBtn1);
          mpController->addWidget(mpText1);
      }
  }

  void MyPage::onInit(gaia::core::Persistence* p) {
      init();
      gaia::core::Scene* scene = gaia::core::Scene::SceneFactory();
      if (scene != NULL) {
          scene->attachController(mpController);
          scene->setupSceneLayout();
      }
  }

virtual int32_t gaia::core::WidgetController::getChildDrawingOrder ( int32_t  childCount,
int32_t  i 
) [protected, virtual]

Returns the index of the child to draw for this iteration.

Override this if you want to change the drawing order of children. By default, it returns i.

NOTE: In order for this method to be called, you must enable child ordering first by calling setChildrenDrawingOrderEnabled(bool).

Parameters:
childCountThe number of child.
iThe current iteration.
Returns:
The index of the child to draw this iteration.
See also:
setChildrenDrawingOrderEnabled(bool)
static int32_t gaia::core::WidgetController::getChildMeasureSpec ( int32_t  spec,
int32_t  padding,
int32_t  childDimension 
) [static]

Does the hard part of measureChildren: figuring out the MeasureSpec to pass to a particular child.

This method figures out the right MeasureSpec for one dimension (height or width) of one child widget.

The goal is to combine information from our MeasureSpec with the LayoutParams of the child to get the best possible results. For example, if the this widget knows its size (because its MeasureSpec has a mode of EXACTLY), and the child has indicated in its LayoutParams that it wants to be the same size as the parent, the parent should ask the child to layout given an exact size.

Parameters:
specThe requirements for this widget
paddingThe padding of this widget for the current dimension and margins, if applicable
childDimensionHow big the child wants to be in the current dimension
Returns:
a MeasureSpec integer for the child
virtual bool gaia::core::WidgetController::getChildStaticTransformation ( Widget *  child,
Transformation *  t 
) [protected, virtual]
bool gaia::core::WidgetController::getChildVisibleRect ( Widget *  child,
gaia::graphics::Rect *  r,
gaia::graphics::Point *  offset 
)

Compute the visible part of a rectangular region defined in terms of a child widget's coordinates.

Returns the clipped visible part of the rectangle r, defined in the child's local coordinate system. r is modified by this method to contain the result, expressed in the global (root) coordinate system. The resulting rectangle is always axis aligned. If a rotation is applied to a node in the Widget hierarchy, the result is the axis-aligned bounding box of the visible rectangle.

Parameters:
childA child Widget, whose rectangular visible region we want to compute
rThe input rectangle, defined in the child coordinate system. Will be overwritten to contain the resulting visible rectangle, expressed in global (root) coordinates
offsetThe input coordinates of a point, defined in the child coordinate system. As with the r parameter, this will be overwritten to contain the global (root) coordinates of that point. A null value is valid (in case you are not interested in this result)
Returns:
true if the resulting rectangle is not empty, false otherwise

virtual WidgetController* gaia::core::WidgetController::invalidateChildInParent ( int32_t *  location,
gaia::graphics::Rect *  dirty 
) [virtual]

It is used for the implementation of the widget hierarchy.

This implementation returns null if this WidgetController does not have a parent, if this WidgetController is already fully invalidated or if the dirty rectangle does not intersect with this WidgetController's bounds.

virtual void gaia::core::WidgetController::measureChild ( Widget *  child,
int32_t  parentWidthMeasureSpec,
int32_t  parentHeightMeasureSpec 
) [protected, virtual]

Ask one of the children of this widget to measure itself, taking into account both the MeasureSpec requirements for this widget and its padding.

The heavy lifting is done in getChildMeasureSpec.

Parameters:
childThe child to measure
parentWidthMeasureSpecThe width requirements for this widget
parentHeightMeasureSpecThe height requirements for this widget
void gaia::core::WidgetController::removeAllWidgets ( )

Call this method to remove all child widgets from the controller.

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::WidgetAnimator.

virtual void gaia::core::WidgetController::removeAllWidgetsInLayout ( ) [virtual]

Called by a WidgetController subclass to remove child widgets from itself, when it must first know its size on screen before it can calculate how many child widgets it will render.

An example is a Gallery or a ListWidget, which may "have" 50 children, but actually only render the number of children that can currently fit inside the object on screen. Do not call this method unless you are extending WidgetController and understand the widget measuring and layout pipeline.

virtual void gaia::core::WidgetController::removeDetachedWidget ( Widget *  child,
bool  animate 
) [protected, virtual]

Finishes the removal of a detached widget.

This method will dispatch the detached from window event and notify the hierarchy change listener.

Parameters:
childthe child to be definitely removed from the widget hierarchy
animateif true and the widget has an animation, the widget is placed in the disappearing widget list, otherwise, it is detached from the window

virtual void gaia::core::WidgetController::setClipChildren ( bool  clipChildren) [virtual]

By default, children are clipped to their bounds before drawing.

This allows WidgetController to override this behavior for animations, etc.

Parameters:
clipChildrentrue to clip children to their bounds, false otherwise
virtual void gaia::core::WidgetController::setClipToPadding ( bool  clipToPadding) [virtual]

By default, children are clipped to the padding of the WidgetController.

This allows WidgetController to override this behavior

Parameters:
clipToPaddingtrue to clip children to the padding of the group, false otherwise
virtual void gaia::core::WidgetController::setControllerTransition ( ControllerTransition *  transition) [virtual]

Sets the ControllerTransition object for this WidgetController.

If the ControllerTransition object is not null, changes in layout which occur because of children being added to or removed from the WidgetController will be animated according to the animations defined in that ControllerTransition object. By default, the transition object is null (so layout changes are not animated).

void gaia::core::WidgetController::setDescendantFocusability ( int32_t  focusability)

Set the descendant focusability of this WidgetController.

This defines the relationship between this WidgetController and its descendants when looking for a widget to take focus in requestFocus(int, graphics::Rect).

Parameters:
focusabilityone of FOCUS_BEFORE_DESCENDANTS, FOCUS_AFTER_DESCENDANTS, FOCUS_BLOCK_DESCENDANTS.
void gaia::core::WidgetController::setMotionEventSplittingEnabled ( bool  split)

Enable or disable the splitting of MotionEvents to multiple children during touch event dispatch.

When this option is enabled MotionEvents may be split and dispatched to different child widgets depending on where each pointer initially went down. This allows for user interactions such as scrolling two panes of content independently, chording of buttons, and performing independent gestures on different pieces of content.

Parameters:
splittrue to allow MotionEvents to be split and dispatched to multiple child widgets. false to only allow one child widget to be the target of any MotionEvent received by this WidgetController.
void gaia::core::WidgetController::setOnHierarchyChangeListener ( IHierarchyChangeListener *  listener)

Register a callback to be invoked when a child is added to or removed from this widget.

Parameters:
listenerThe listener that would like to listene the hierarchy change.

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::RadioGroup.

virtual void gaia::core::WidgetController::setStaticTransformationsEnabled ( bool  enabled) [virtual]

When this property is set to true, this WidgetController supports static transformations on children; this causes getChildStaticTransformation() to be invoked when a child is drawn.

Any subclass overriding getChildStaticTransformation() should set this property to true.

Parameters:
enabledTrue to enable static transformations on children, false otherwise.
